How to use ARC board¶

Purpose¶

  1. To get familiar with ARC board and on-board peripherals
  2. To how to use ARC board and on-board peripherals
  3. To how to debug the ARC board and on-board peripherals

Equipment¶

  • PC host
  • GNU Toolchain for ARC Processors / MetaWare Development Toolkit
  • ARC board (EM Starter Kit / IoT Development Kit)
  • embarc_osp/arc_labs/labs/lab5_emsk / embarc_osp/arc_labs/lab5_iotdk

Content¶

  1. Board introduction.

Through the user manual, get a brief knowledge of ARC board and what peripherals are on it.

  1. Board programming.

Based on embARC OSP, program the on board peripherals.

Principles¶

  1. EM Starter Kit

For the basic introduction of EM Starter Kit, please go embARC OSP Documentation

There are on board LEDs, DIP switches and buttons on EM Starter Kit, this lab will show how to program theses on-board peripherals of EM Starter Kit.

The code for EM Starter Kit is located in embarc_osp/arc_labs/labs/lab5_emsk. In the code, the buttons and DIP switches values of EM Starter Kit are read and LED blinks periodically.

  1. IoT Development Kit

For the basic introduction of IoT Development Kit, please go embARC OSP Documentation

As there are no LED or other easy-to-use on board peripherals on IoT Development Kit, this lab will show how to control a LED through the arduino interface of IoT Development Kit.

Steps¶

EM Starter Kit¶

  1. Connect EM Starter Kit to PC, select em7d configuration and open UART terminal.
  2. Compile and run the embarc_osp/arc_labs/lab5_emsk example with the following cmds.
cd /arc_labs/lab5_emsk
make TOOLCHAIN=gnu BOARD=emsk BD_VER=22 CUR_CORE=em7d run
  1. Watch the changes of LEDs, press the buttons and toggle the DIP switches, then watch the result in UART terminal.

IoT Development Kit¶

IoT Development Kit has a arduino interface, here select arduino digital pinout ARDUINO_PIN_0(iotdk gpio4b_2[0]) to control LEDs.

  1. find a LED, connect the LED anode pin to ARDUINO_PIN_0, connect the LED cathode pin to GND of IoT Development Kit.
  2. compile and run the embarc_osp/arc_labs/lab5_iotdk example.

Note

The connection between LED and IoT Development Kit is just for test. A 1kΩ resistor should be added in series connection to limited the current and prevent damage to I/O pin.

Exercises¶

Try to create you own application to program the peripherals of ARC board
